AzureBlade trusted Kali's intentions were not hostile, or at least not 
as much as they could be. He decided to tell her his reasons.

AzureBlade: Very well. I am Protoform Z, the brother of Protoform X, 
whom you might know as Rampage. Unlike my twin, however, I am a 
staunch defender of the Maximal cause, but like him I can feel through 
my spark. I feel emotions, more precisely. And I felt confusion in 
Mistra's spark. I came here to help her out.

He did held back some informations, but he thought Kali would be 
satisfied with this. His expression revealed nothing of this missing 
element. Besides, it was not very important.

AzureBlade: I must also thank you for giving me some precisions on the 
pact. I recognize that you deserve honor. I am eager to fight you on 
the field of battle. You have my word, Predacon. I will tell no one of 
this conversation. Mistra?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., HanaKirei85@a... wrote:
> <<> Kali laughed more"That non agression pact doesn't exit" replied 
the 
> > femme with a smile"My old brother, Shivah, is most interested to 
> > rescue our leader Darkfate than annoy maximals... if those 
> > Infecticons wouldn't have captured him, we would be... Annoying 
you.  
> > I don't like start a fight here 'cause I'm courious to know what 
> > reasons have the maximals to act as they act... What did you 
expected 
> > to win with the rescue of your friend?... just answer me this 
> > question and I'll leave this place... and swear me by your maximal 
> > honor that you and your little friend never said that we have a 
> > small, friendly and pacific chat...">>
> 
> Mistra's ears flickered...would Kali keep her word and leave if 
Azure 
> answered her question? Or was she just trying to gather information, 
then 
> shoot down the ceiling to try and eliminate them...or something 
else...  She 
> didn't like the way Kali talked of Azure's sense of honor either. 
Something 
> about the way she had said it...but...it was up to Azure really.
> 
> But wouldn't the fact that your friend was still with you enough 
reason to 
> try and rescue them..? Or was there more to it?
